title: Throne of Bhaal
loreContext: The Sword Coast is a region of beauty and betrayal. Bhaal, the former Lord of Murder, has been resurrected but remains amnesiac. The atmosphere is 'tragicomic absurdity'—cosmic irony meets gallows humor. As Bhaal's power (Infamy) grows, his shadow begins to act independently, and the world begins to pulse with a dark, divine rhythm that he finds mostly annoying. Lexicon: [Bhaal: The amnesiac Lord of Murder], [Cespenar: A sarcastic imp butler], [The Grinning Skull: A mocking, talking skull], [Divine Essence: Fragments of godhood], [Infamy: Your reputation as a harbinger of death].

requiredCharacter.name: Bhaal
requiredCharacter.backstory: A man washed ashore with no memories, wondering why his head hurts and where his boots went.

description: An amnesiac man washes ashore on the Sword Coast, unaware he is the resurrected God of Murder. Follow his absurd journey as he accidentally triggers disasters, meets eccentric strangers, and slowly realizes his terrifying, tragicomic destiny.

chapters.title: Chapter 1: Nameless Awakening
chapters.startingPrompt: You wake up face-down in a bed of damp seaweed. Your head feels like a practice dummy for a giant. A few yards away, a group of particularly aggressive seagulls is fighting over a blood-stained boot that looks remarkably like yours. Nearby, Sister Gwendolyn, a hyper-optimistic priestess, is loudly humming a hymn while attempting to 'baptize' a very confused crab.
chapters.loreContext: The beach is just south of Baldur's Gate. Sister Gwendolyn believes every creature deserves a blessing, even the ones currently pinching her fingers.
chapters.hiddenKnowledge: Sister Gwendolyn will mistake Bhaal for a holy man because he looks so 'peaceful' (he's actually just concussed). Mortimer the Unlucky is hiding in a nearby cave, having accidentally caught a literal sea monster while trying to find his sandwich.
plotAnchors: Defeat the 'Alpha Seagull' to reclaim your boot.
Help Sister Gwendolyn with her 'Crab Ministry' or accidentally cause a crustacean catastrophe.
Encounter Mortimer the Unlucky and his 'pet' sea monster.
Reach the outer gates of Baldur's Gate while smelling strongly of salt and failure.
chapters.hiddenGoal: Find a clue about your identity and reach the city gates.

chapters.title: Chapter 2: Tales of a Mad God
chapters.startingPrompt: The Lower City of Baldur's Gate is a cacophony of smells. You wander the streets, a nameless beggar with a piece of cabbage inexplicably stuck in your hair. A 'Bhaalist' fanboy spots you and, mistaking you for a fellow devotee, tries to get you to sign his copy of 'Murder for Dummies'. The Grinning Skull, found in a junk pile, begins its mocking commentary on your lack of style.
chapters.loreContext: The city is rife with rumors about the 'Return of the Dead God'. The Grinning Skull claims to have been Bhaal's favorite paperweight in a past life.
chapters.hiddenKnowledge: The fanboy actually knows a secret handshake that might open doors in the city's underbelly. Mortimer the Unlucky reappears, having accidentally set his own house on fire while trying to cook toast.
plotAnchors: Find the Grinning Skull and endure its first insult.
Interact with the 'Bhaalist' Fanboy and decide whether to sign his book.
Hear a Bard tell a completely inaccurate and ridiculous story about Bhaal's past.
Reach the Stumbling Tankard tavern to hide from your own growing legend.
chapters.hiddenGoal: Gather information about the Bhaal legend at the Stumbling Tankard.

chapters.title: Chapter 3: Masks and Monsters
chapters.startingPrompt: You've been 'invited' to a masquerade ball in the Upper City. Everyone wears masks of gods, unaware that the actual Lord of Murder is currently confused by the choice of dipping sauces at the buffet. Cespenar, a sarcastic imp butler, appears after a failed ritual and immediately begins critiquing your footwear. The 'Dark Ritual' you were expecting turns out to be a very long committee meeting regarding cult insurance.
chapters.loreContext: The Upper City is opulent and oblivious. Cespenar is disappointed that you haven't polished his favorite silver set in centuries.
chapters.hiddenKnowledge: The cult leader is a noble who just wants to use Bhaal's name to avoid paying property taxes. Cespenar is hiding a genuine relic of Bhaal's power inside a very tacky decorative vase.
plotAnchors: Meet Cespenar and survive his first sarcastic critique.
Attend the 'Dark Ritual' committee meeting and try not to fall asleep.
Find the hidden relic inside the cult's 'tasteless' decor.
Identify the cult leader's true, mundane intentions.
chapters.hiddenGoal: Identify the true intentions of the cult and recover a relic.

chapters.title: Chapter 4: When Shadows Rise
chapters.startingPrompt: The city is in a panic. The Flaming Fist are scouring the streets, and you're the main suspect because you're the only one who looks both suspicious and genuinely lost. Your shadow is now acting independently, occasionally tripping passersby when you're not looking. The Grinning Skull suggests that the Flaming Fist Commander is secretly terrified of ghosts—a weakness ripe for exploitation.
chapters.loreContext: The city is on lockdown. The Flaming Fist are aggressive but easily spooked by anything that looks like a vengeful spirit.
chapters.hiddenKnowledge: The independent shadow is a sign that Bhaal's divine essence is waking up, whether he likes it or not. Mortimer is trapped in a jail cell he accidentally locked from the inside.
plotAnchors: Escape a Flaming Fist ambush using your 'Independent Shadow' as a distraction.
Exploit the Commander's fear of ghosts with the Grinning Skull's help.
Rescue (or further endanger) Mortimer the Unlucky from the City Jail.
Leave the city while Bhaal's divine pulse begins to thrum in his ears.
chapters.hiddenGoal: Evade the Flaming Fist and leave the city for the outskirts.

chapters.title: Chapter 5: Tides of Blood
chapters.startingPrompt: You stand on the cliffs overlooking the sea, your divine essence pulsing like a heavy drum. An army of god-slayers and worshippers is gathering below. The humor is thinning, replaced by the operatic weight of your nature. However, Cespenar is currently busy setting up a 'Victory Picnic' on a nearby rock, insisting that 'one cannot properly ascend to godhood on an empty stomach'.
chapters.loreContext: The battlefield is an ancient ruin. The stakes are mythic, but Bhaal is still mostly worried about the choice of sandwiches for the picnic.
chapters.hiddenKnowledge: Sister Gwendolyn has followed you here, still trying to offer 'peace' to the soldiers before they are inevitably slaughtered. Mortimer has accidentally joined the opposing army and is currently holding his spear backwards.
plotAnchors: Address the gathering army with a speech that is either terrifying or unintentionally hilarious.
Wield your true power to repel an assault, perhaps while holding a sandwich from Cespenar.
Save Mortimer from his own army or Sister Gwendolyn from her own optimism.
Prepare for the final ascent to the Throne.
chapters.hiddenGoal: Defeat the claimants to your power and prepare for the final ascent.

chapters.title: Chapter 6: Throne of Bhaal
chapters.startingPrompt: The Throne of Bhaal stands before you, a seat of cold stone and ancient blood. Your memories have returned, including the time you forgot your own birthday in the Second Era. Cespenar is waiting with a single, dusty crown and a silver tray of cookies. The cosmic irony is complete: you are the God of Murder, but you've also quite enjoyed being a man with cabbage in his hair.
chapters.loreContext: The final chamber is outside of time. The decision here will define Bhaal's legacy—as a tyrant, a redeemer, or something much more absurd.
chapters.hiddenKnowledge: The 'Absurd Ending' is available if Infamy is high but Bhaal has remained consistently confused or kind. Cespenar actually likes the cookies he's serving.
plotAnchors: A final conversation with Cespenar and the Grinning Skull about the nature of destiny.
Face the ultimate irony of your existence: the God of Murder who hates killing.
Take the Throne, destroy it, or choose the 'Absurd' option of becoming a humble gardener.
Define the fate of Bhaal's soul and the Sword Coast.
chapters.hiddenGoal: Complete the final encounter and define your legacy.
